text:
Mary Elizabeth Chieffo (born 1992)[3] is an American actress known for portraying the Klingon L'Rell on the television series Star Trek: Discovery.[4]

Biography [ edit ]

Chieffo was born and grew up in the neighborhood of Valley Village, Los Angeles in California, only daughter of actors Michael Chieffo and Beth Grant.[2] Her acting debut was at the age of three when she played a sleeping girl in Sandra Bullock's short film Making Sandwiches, in which her mother also had a role, and later acted in various TV shows and short and feature films.[3]

She attended the Drama division of Juilliard School in New York City, earning a Bachelor of Fine Arts degree in 2015.[3] One of her classmates was future Star Trek: Discovery castmate Mary Wiseman.[5] Her first high profile acting position was on Star Trek: Discovery, where she played the recurring character of L'Rell, a Klingon warrior and spy who becomes leader of the Klingon Empire at the end of Season 1.[6]
